Authors:
Wei-Bin Xu, Tao Meng, Qiang Zhang, Wang-Hui Wu, Yan Liu,
Kuo-Fang Chung
Title:
Three new species and one new combination of Petrocodon
(Gesneriaceae) from limestone karsts of Guangxi, China based on
morphological and molecular data
Keywords:
Lagarosolen, molecular taxonomy, Old World Didymocarpoid
Gesneriaceae, Primulina, rare and endangered plants, Sino-Vietnamese
limestone karst
Abstract:
Based on morphological and molecular data, three new
species of the Old World Didymocarpoid Gesneriaceae, Petrocodon
laxiflorus, P. nonggangensis, and P. pseudocoriaceifolius, are described
and illustrated from Guangxi, China. These three new species are most
similar to P. coriaceifolius, differing by their texture, size, and
shape of leaves, inflorescence, corolla size and pubescence, anther
shape, and pistil length. Additionally, Primulina guangxiensis was shown
to be allied with Petrocodon in our ongoing phylogenetic analyses,
prompting us to make the new combination P. guangxiensis. These four
species of Petrocodon are all only known from a single or a few
localities of limestone karst in Guangxi and are either endangered (EN)
or critically endangered (CR) based on IUCN criteria.
